file_content.text: Thanks to you, Quesh is nearly under Imperial rule. All that remains is the Republic army's complete annihilation.
The Jedi and his Hutt are dead.
Excellent! The Republic will be furious.
Master Fraal's dead. Broga's still breathing, but is sworn to the Empire.
Excellent! I'd prefer the Hutt dead, but his cooperation will further infuriate the Republic.
You have my thanks, and that of my council. We'd still be fighting over Quesh's mines if not for your help.
No need to thank me.
Your dedication won't be ignored. And if you're still invested in our war, there's more work to be done.
Does the Empire have something in store for this planet?
What happens to Quesh now?
In time we will take over the Quesh venom industry. As for our military, there's still plenty to do.
My talents are unsurpassed.
I couldn't agree more. That is why Quesh still needs you.
The Republic's still fighting. Help us pile up enough bodies here, they'll retaliate on other planets. Then we'll have our war.
But first enjoy your victory. Quesh will soon be ours, and the Republic grows more furious by the day.
The Republic thinks Master Fraal can save them. Prove them wrong.
We have a Hutt on the loose--Broga, the last leader of the Three Families. He escaped before your assault.
As if losing that Hutt slime wasn't enough, we have a new problem. A powerful Jedi Master named Berin Fraal just landed on Quesh.
Fraal was talking to the Hutts when I arrived. He didn't appreciate the interruption.
I know. I met the Jedi.
You must have scared him. Master Fraal is wasting no time.
They're digging in for something big. We better hit them first.
The Republic's regrouping.
I'll deploy our army at once. Master Fraal mustn't have time to strike.
He's already amassing forces with Broga the Hutt. Slay them both, and the Republic's stranglehold on Quesh will crumble.
They will bow to my power. Then they will die.
As you wish.
Thank you, my lord. Show the Republic how weak they are.
This planet will soon belong to the Empire. Leave the details to me.
They won't live another day.
I'll bag the Jedi and his Hutt pet.
They're as good as dead.
I'll give it a shot.
Do your best to kill them. That's all I ask.
I'll kill 'em for the credits.
I assure you, the Empire will pay well for their deaths.
Quesh deserves some peace. If that means killing these agitators, so be it.
Anything to end this battle.
Don't forget--we're here to spark war, not extinguish it.
Find Master Fraal and Broga in the Quesh venom plant. Tear the facility apart. Make sure they don't leave the place alive.
They'll both die by my hands.
I was hoping you'd jump at their throats.
Master Fraal's hiding out with Broga the Hutt. They're in the central Quesh venom processing plant.
Tear that plant apart. Kill the Jedi and his Hutt friend.
Moff Dracen--I'm patched in to the Hutt's mainframe.
This is it--everything the Three Families knew about processing Quesh venom. We can erase the Republic's head-start in minutes!
Fantastic.
The Empire owes you much. Thanks to you, the Republic is quickly losing control of Quesh.
I'll take your word for it.
Excuse me. Our top researchers will pour over these findings. I can't thank you enough.
Where's your gratitude?
Thank you, of course. The Republic will be furious once we use this data to ramp up our own Quesh venom operation.
I see you've killed Jeelta and Portho. Outstanding. I wish there was time to celebrate, but our fight's not over yet.
I see you've killed Jeelta and... Portho? You're still alive?
What? Oh, hello, Moff. Just took a few adrenals. Care to join me?
Foolish slug. I suppose we can use him--after we fix his adrenal habit. But our fight's not over yet.
Kill the Republic's Hutt friends, and the Three Families will fall.
Without adrenals or their Quesh venom supply, the Republic is finally vulnerable! We must hit the Three Families with everything we have.
Slay the Hutt slime, their secrets die with them--the Republic can't process Quesh venom.
And they'll be pushed to the brink of galactic war. All we must do is kill the leaders of the Three Families.
The Hutts will fall under my lightsaber.
I will lead the assault.
When I'm through, the Hutts will beg me to kill them.
I'll slay them myself.
I'm glad you're so eager, my lord. We'll prepare for your attack at once.
Hutts make easy targets.
I'll execute them.
No one is better equipped for the job. We'll prepare for your operation immediately.
You want these Hutts dead? Pay me their weight in credits.
Three bounties will cost you.
I'll see that your payment matches the prey.
We've got the Republic on edge. The Hutts will be well-guarded.
They'll anticipate our attack.
Indeed. We have an inside contact who should help us level the playing field.
Is killing them necessary?
We have no choice. Showing the Three Families mercy weakens our position.
Colonel, wake Portho the Hutt from whatever adrenal-addled haze he's drowning in.
Moff Dracen? Should've known you'd attack soon--and during my afternoon adrenals!
Too bad my compatriots just upped security. There's no getting past the front doors now.
Your pathetic Hutt defenses can't stop a Sith.
Nothing will hold me back.
Even the best security can be bypassed.
We'll see about that.
You could try taking out the main gate's shields. But there's another way...
I've busted down plenty of doors. This won't be any different.
Wanna bet?
I didn't mean it's impossible. There's just another way you could get in...
Prove your worth, Portho. There must be another entrance.
Is there an alternate way in?
Well--I suppose there is one thing we could try.
Remember, Portho: A useless Hutt is a dead Hutt.
Then why do we need you alive?
Don't be hasty! I can work something out!
My Chevin adviser, Norvaan Kel--he could smuggle a small group past security using my best adrenals.
They're strong enough for Hutts--you'll be knocked out cold. Norvaan can give you the adrenal then sneak you in.
I'd rather not be comatose in the middle of a firefight.
Seems risky.
You'll be awakened once inside. And the after effects are clean, I promise.
You'll pay if this is a trap.
It's the truth. Hutt's honor!
I could use some shut-eye before slaughtering your friends.
I love a nap before murder.
If you say so. I'll make the arrangements, just in case.
We'll take your recommendation under advisement, Portho. Use your adrenals. When you awake, you'll be the only surviving member of the Three Families.
You heard the fool: either fight through the front, or take Portho's adrenals and be smuggled in. Your choice.
The Hutt can keep his concoction. I'd rather fight on my feet.
I prefer a direct fight.
Portho gave us schematics on the palace's security. You'll need these EMP charges to scramble the generators shielding the main door.
Excellent. Once you're inside, kill the leaders of the Three Families--Portho, too. Then upload their data on Quesh venom processing to me.
I'll take the Hutt's concoction. Best to save my energy for the fight inside the palace.
The adrenal's the safest path.
Norvaan Kel's hiding out behind the palace grounds. Security should be light during the battle.
Take that Chevin's adrenal to infiltrate the palace. Once inside, kill the leaders of the Three Families--including Portho. Then transmit their data on Quesh venom processing to me.
I just spoke with Graag. He said you shut down the factories, and the fight's under control. Well done.
The factories won't fall without you!
Our next move is to hit the Republic again. Hard.
Hello, Imps. Graag the Hutt is here. You ready?
Send him in. Quickly.
Graag is a leader of the Hutt Cartel. He keeps repulsive company, but he's proven a valuable ally.
I can take down the next target without Hutt interference.
I don't need his help.
That may be. But we can't afford to turn away Graag's support just yet.
Why is a Hutt working with the Empire?
He's an ally?
You could say Graag was forced to cooperate.
Never trust a Hutt.
Don't worry--Graag is dependable.
He's here to make amends for the Three Families, a band of venom-sniffing Hutts.
They violated the Cartel's neutrality to help the Republic's mining operation on Quesh.
Such favoritism deeply upset the Empire. The Cartel claimed ignorance and disowned the Three Families.
With the rogue Hutts isolated, all that's left is the killing blow.
The Three Families are doomed.
But first we must sever their source of income: the Republic's adrenal factories. Only then can we destroy the Three Families.
I'm sure they took kickbacks from the Three Families and looked the other way.
The Cartel must have known.
You're probably right. To make amends, the Cartel sent Graag--one of their finest leaders--to help us punish the Three Families.
Spare me the Hutt trivia.
I simply remind you that the Empire's not alone. As a Cartel leader, Graag kindly "volunteered" to help us punish the Three Families.
Don't mention those traitors! They make my blood boil!
Graag, good of you to join us! Allow me to introduce our newest allies on Quesh.
Gaze upon me, Hutt. You won't see someone so powerful again in your lifetime.
The honor is yours.
I'd ask you to bow to my magnificence, but... well, you know.
The honor is yours.
You've made quite the impression on Quesh, Sith. Finally, we'll have the Force on our side as well.
It's a pleasure, Graag. Imperial Intelligence will be glad to hear of your cooperation.
I'm watching you.
I--I understand. Good to have your organization's support.
I've dealt with your kind before. Don't try me.
Watch yourself, slug.
I thought I recognized you. Nem'ro's friend, right? If his stories are true, I'm glad you're on our side.
Hello, Graag.
The pleasure's mine. But I'm afraid I bring bad news--our forces are in trouble.
I didn't sign on for handshakes. What's the next target?
Let's stick to business.
Jedi have joined the defense of the Republic's factories. Even the Cartel's droid army can't maintain the assault for long.
The Three Families won't be vulnerable until we sever their income. Are you ready to kill these Jedi and cripple the Republic's adrenal production?
Time to hit the Republic where it hurts.
Let's do it.
I guess I'm ready.
Don't get too excited.
This will be too easy.
Don't discount the Republic's strength. They're far more familiar with Quesh.
Graag--have your army hold the factories. Don't allow the Republic a second's rest.
Cut down the Jedi defenders. Then either destroy the adrenal production lines or kill the Selkath scientists operating them.
The scientists chose the wrong day to show up for work.
No Selkath will survive.
The scientists are just doing their job. I'll cripple their equipment.
The machinery will fail.
If that's your choice. Just don't return until those factories have ground to a halt.
Graag, you finally grace us with your presence! Let me introduce the Empire's greatest weapon on Quesh.
The mines are poisoned. The Republic's running scared.
Excellent work. You also did a fine job razing their emplacements. My forces will have no trouble cleaning up your scraps.
Fantastic. We won't give them a chance to recover.
The Republic's held Quesh for too long. Rip those mines from their grasp.
The Empire can't afford another loss, major. We must crush the Republic immediately!
They've been on Quesh for years--we can't destroy their entire mining operation overnight!
Gentlemen. We have company.
I'm Moff Dracen. Head of Quesh Imperial forces. You're here to join our war against the Republic?
My lightsaber's itching for Republic victims.
War? I can't wait.
Not just join--I'll win it.
Consider me your best weapon.
This operation's under control. We don't need Sith running wild down here.
Insult the dark side. Sith love that.
Oh good. I smell a fight.
I can't pass up the Empire's favorite pastime.
Correct, sir.
The Imperial military has the situation well in hand. We don't need Intelligence down here playing games!
No games. Just tell me who to kill.
I'll keep things simple.
My rates skyrocket during wartime.
Sure, but it'll cost you.
I'm sure we can work out a deal.
The Empire has the situation in hand. We don't need stinking mercenaries to win!
Your forces are nothing compared to the power of the dark side.
But you do need a Sith.
Don't worry, Major. I keep my companions on a tight leash.
I'll keep my people in line.
That's not my point. The Empire can win this war!
The Empire must use all of its assets to crush the Republic.
Tell me about the conflict.
Quesh is a valuable planet, if you can believe it. We're here to stop the Republic's operation.
It's your war, not mine.
Quesh is valuable. To the Republic, and to the Empire.
This is absurd! We don't need their kind interfering with our war!
There's more power in my fist than in your entire army.
Oh really? [Force Choke]
Let me remind you of the dark side's power, Major.
Oh really? [Shock him]
Your manners need polish, Major.
Is that so? [Punch him]
Maybe a broken jaw will improve your perspective.
Oh really? [Punch him]
Enough. Save it for the Republic.
I suppose you have your own victory plan.
Go on, major.
That's right. My men take the mines, make the Republic panic. Then we propose a truce and ambush their leaders.
Quaint theatrics won't work. Brutality, carnage--that's how you break the Republic.
What a pitiful display.
I won't stand for this outrage!
Yes, you will, major. Take your anger out on the Republic.
They're responsible for our assignment to this toxic rock. The Republic went digging and found the source of this planet's poison.
The miners call it "Quesh venom." Lies just below the planet's surface.
We distill the stuff into Quell, a lethal poison. But the Republic knows how to refine it into high-grade adrenals.
They've been processing the toxins into adrenals for years, with Hutt help no less. We've come to conquer their operation and claim Quesh's venom for the Empire.
Tear down the Republic. Grind them into Quesh's soil.
Destroy them all.
Turn Quesh into a monument of Imperial cruelty.
Make the Republic suffer.
I knew you'd have the appetite for this work. The Republic's defeat must be devastating.
Carve their defeat into Quesh.
Make a show of it.
My goal exactly. Their ruin must be cataclysmic.
If this is Republic territory, they won't go down easy.
That's a tall order.
But they will be ruined. The Empire won't settle for less.
The Empire wouldn't wage war on this scale just for resources.
You're after something else.
Correct. The adrenals are a bonus. Our primary goal is to test the Republic.
Yet the Republic's still here.
The Republic's downfall must be cataclysmic. Devastation on that level takes time.
Push them enough on Quesh, and the Republic will be provoked into open warfare across the galaxy.
Once they violate the Treaty of Coruscant, the Empire can strike without risking neutral worlds joining in. We must rile their temper.
I have a talent for rousing the Republic's fury.
Let me anger them.
I can't wait to see you test their restraint.
Provoking them to all-out war won't be easy.
They'll be hard to push.
That's why we must bend them to their breaking point.
Politics aren't my concern.
Let me rephrase. We must goad the Republic into open warfare. Help, and you'll be compensated.
First, we strike the Republic's venom mines.
The venom produces noxious gas. That's why Quesh is so lovely. It's most lethal in the mines, so the Republic installed specialized filters.
Destroy those filters, release the poisonous gas, and the Republic will have to flee the mines.
They'll declare the mines a disaster site when I'm finished.
Consider it done.
I'm kind of busy.
Don't delay. Our forces already siege the mines.
Take out every weapon emplacement you can, then get inside and destroy the filtration units. Don't stop until the mines are choked with poison.
Count me out. [Refuse quest]
Then we'll proceed according to plan. Enjoy your time on Quesh.
Enough! We don't need his help!
Don't waste your energy on her. A woman has no place on the battlefield.
This is a private council. Leave us.
Be careful--the Republic's discovered Portho's treachery. Hurry, before the Hutts escape!
Portho fulfilled his promise, for once. Consider these mercenaries his payment for your mercy.
